title.narrative: Well prepared Red Cross/Red Crescent societies for disaster response: Mali

description.narrative: Mali is vulnerable to both drought and floods, caused by the country’s dry tropical climate with highly variable alternating dry and rainy periods and the passing through of two of Africa’s major rivers. Other hazards are locust invasions, epidemics, bush fire and population movement due to conflict in the North of the country. Socio-economic and environmental factors such as people’s dependence of rain-fed agriculture, poverty (Mali ranks 176 out of 187 on the Human Development Index of 2013e), settlement in flood risk areas and environmental degradation further aggravate the impact of disasters. While data related to casualties linked to disasters are not available, the government of Mali estimated that over the last 30 years more than three million people have been affected. Building on the results and lessons learned from the Response Preparedness programme 2012-2015 (RP-I) the Response Preparedness programme 2016-2019 (RP-II) aims at achieving a better prepared response mechanism for disasters for Mali.
Most activities are national - however, a specific focus will be paid to Mopti and Kayes region.

RP-II aims at 1. Functioning contingency plans for selected areas. 2. Sufficient DM staff and volunteers are trained and available for response. 3. Adequate response infrastructure. 4. strong network to provide and improve its emergency response. 5. Adopted innovative response mechanisms (eg. FbF, CTP). 6. sufficient capacity built to perform core functions in emergency response.

The program being a capacity building on Response and Preparedness, the beneficiaries will be the MRCS itself (recipient of capacity building trainings) and the population of Mali affected by disasters in three southern regions of Mali.
This project supports the Mali Red Cross to enhance their emergency response capacity in selected regions.

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

title.narrative: RP - Operational capacity
Relevant staff and volunteers are trained on the procedures and use of forms

comment.narrative: Kayes regional branch which has 7 circles, has been reinforced with trainings, support and great partnership. Other regions of MRCS has other partners
the kayes regional branch which has 7 circles, has been reinforced with training. The 6 other regional branches of the MRCs have contingency plan trainers following training on the contingency plan

title.narrative: Simulations and drills are conducted with national authorities and other organisations

comment.narrative: Following the training of the regional volunteers and the development of the flood contingency plan, a simulation was carried out. a life-size simulation will be realized this year with all the partners and other actors

Following the trainings CDRT and NDRT and the development of flood contingency plan, a simulation was carried out each time. a real-size simulation will be realized in 2019-2020 with all the partners and other actors

title.narrative: NS has mechanisms to anticipate and respond to major hazards in coordination with the national system

comment.narrative: MRC is a member of the national risk reduction platform. It is consulted to give its opinion on certain subjects, in particular the elaboration of the country's multihasard ex contingency plan. she participates in the meetings

MRCs is a member of the national risk reduction platform. she participated in the drafting of the country's multi-hazard contingency plan and coordination meetings at the national level with the Ministry of Social Development and Humanitarian Action and Civil Protection

MRCs is an important member of the national risk reduction platform. she participated in the drafting of the country's multi-hazard contingency plan and coordination meetings at the national level with the Ministry of Social Development and Humanitarian Action and Civil Protection

title.narrative: NS has an approved warehouse and stock management manual with standard forms and templates

comment.narrative: 7 circles in Kayes and the HQ of MRCS in Kayes has location with prepositioned stocks

title.narrative: RP - Operational support
EOC has intended space with sufficient equipment to manage information and coordination that does not affect other NS activities

comment.narrative: The process is ongoing, an EOC will be delivered in 2019 for MRCS with soft and hard components

title.narrative: Procedures exist to activate, deploy and manage branch and national response teams

comment.narrative: 4 teams were trained, 1 NDRT and 3 CDRT. They receive good training and materials to be proactive and available at any time

title.narrative: NS allocates resources to conduct evaluations and/or reviews of the operation to identify and integrate key lessons and recommendations

comment.narrative: A PER (preparedness for effective response) exercice was done in April 2019 and show very positive evolution in core domain of disaster and risk management. Best evolution were noted in Contingency Plan (MRCS developed 2 mains CP in Civil Unrest and Floods), CDRT BDRT NDRT available and ready to be deploy for emergencies and in Needs Assessment

title.narrative: CDRTs are trained and equipped to handle local response in partnership with relevant local actors

title.narrative: RP - Coordination
NS is formally part of the national humanitarian coordination system, participates regularly and informs partners on RCRC Movement capacities in case of international support is required

comment.narrative: MRCS has agreement with Civilian Protection (DGPC), Hydrological department of Mali Government (DNH) and Mali Mat Office. A 4th agreement with Geographical Department of University Bamako

There are no signs yet with the main actors, however, the collaboration has been strengthened. the partners lead working groups with MRCs and take an active part in the reinforcement of the capcites of the volunteers and barnches of the MRCs

the agreements are not yet signed, however the partners lead the working groups with the CRM and take an active part in strengthening the capacity of volunteers and branches of the MRCs. ex mali meteo, hydraulic, civil protection

title.narrative: NS is familiar with the IFRC emergency funding mechanisms (Emergency Appeals, DREF and Forecast-based Financing by DREF), their procedures and required supporting documents (EPoA).

comment.narrative: A DREF was submitted and accepted for floods in Mali and specially in Kayes. RPII structures and trainings CP help MRCS to do a good assessment and a good quality written DREF. Prepositioned stock of NFI were used for 1st emergency assistance (200 hundreds people)

title.narrative: NS has procedures to manage information between community to branches and branch to headquarters and vice versa

comment.narrative: Discussion are ongoing and 510 will deliver a training to achieve that in July 2019

title.narrative: NS is familiar with the IFRC emergency funding mechanisms (Emergency Appeals, DREF and Forecast-based Financing by DREF), their procedures and required supporting documents (EPoA).

comment.narrative: No situation for an EA since start of RPII
No situation for an EA since start of RPII

title.narrative: RP - Analysis and planning
NS has up-to-date, approved SOPs for all specific areas of intervention and support services for disasters and crises

comment.narrative: Inside development of contingency plan, 2 SOPs were developed for each of hazards. SOPs are revised and updated for each exercise

title.narrative: Contingency plans for high risks are developed and reviewed on an annual basis

comment.narrative: 2 contingency plans were developed in 2017 through RPII, one for floods and another for civil unrest. Hazards were choose in an exercice of prioritization and mandate of MRCS. Both CP are annually revised and update. In 2019 we revised them in April 2019 to take in account lessons learned from 2 last use of CP in 2018 for both CP.

title.narrative: Early warning system is established, and includes thresholds (including for slow on-set disasters) and required mechanisms to communicate and activate early action

comment.narrative: The process of validation for an EAP is ongoing, bug progress were done but need to be reinforced

title.narrative: Other - People reached
People living in communities benefitting from resilience interventions

comment.narrative: Around 1'000 persons were direct beneficiaries of NFI distribution. But we can estimate at more than 30'000 indirect beneficiaries for all preparedness and training activities
